body:
I am using Daysim 3.1 since Ecotect needs an older GUI. 
now I want to stick to the pipeline Ecotect#Radiance#Daysim3.1 as far as possible. Not aqainted with other workflows on daylighting.   For this reason i would not like to take the newer version of Daysim.    Raypath is set as follow    
    working on Windows7 professional    
    System Variables    BIN_PATH - 






C:\RADIANCE\bin;C:\Daysim\bin    PATH - 














 C:\Program Files (x86)\Parallels\Parallels Tools\Applications;.....;\\....\Downloads\#_00_name\#_01_test\dxf2rad09win;C:\Radiance\bin;$PATH
RAYPATH 






 .;C:\Radiance\lib\.;C:\Daysim\lib.


User Variables
BIN_PATH - 






C:\Daysim\bin_windows\;C:\Radiance\bin\;C:\DAYSIM    PATH - 
















C:\Daysim\bin_windows\;C:\Radiance\bin\;C:\DAYSIM    RAYPATH - 








.;C:\Daysim\lib\.;C:\Radiance\lib\.;C:\Daysim\lib\.;C:\Radiance\lib\.;C:\Radiance\bin\    
    note: the dots are not in the path, ive included since thats too much odd info, i think    I appreciate any advice that can bring me further.    
    Kind Regards,    Niya   










 -------- Оригинално писмо --------


От: Jan Wienold jan.wienold at epfl.ch


Относно: Re: [Radiance-daysim] DAysim_warning message


До: DAYSIM discussion  


Изпратено на: Сряда, 2014, Ноември 12 17:01:11 EET












   it seems you are using an old version of gendaylit (the new version don t need these files any more). Maybe this old version is still part of the daysim package. You should replace it by the new version from the radiance distribution.


 I also assume you have a path problem. Are you sure you set the RAYPATH variable correct? In the /lib directory you should find the missing files, but then the old version of gendaylit should work. 


 Jan
